It's 5:30 AM and I know this is going to come as a shock to some but #Blockchain isn't a solution for everything. There, I said it. Someone had to.
I saw an article the other day talking about how Blockchain is going to revolutionize the cheese making process. Really? Maybe but really?
Look, before everyone looses their damn minds please remember that the hyperledger should be a small but integral part of an over arching solution.
An example would be an eCommerce website built on node.js that has tons of business logic and functionality but simply stores details of the transactions on the Blockchain through Smart Contracts.
Don't waste your time, money, or sanity trying to build the entire solution on the chain. Now I want some cheese.
Daniel BurrusDaniel Burrus is a LinkedIn Influencer

summary: Joe founded Software Ops in 2008, the very beginning of the mobile revolution. Today Software Ops has offices in Scottsdale with 11 employees and is growing at an annual rate of 40% over 6 years. Joe's vision for Software Ops is to help mid-cap businesses and startups build high quality custom mobile and cloud based software platforms that increases their top line income and/or lowers their operational costs to improve profitability. To bring extensive knowledge of software development and mobile technology to the marketplace so it can help business and people better compete in the new world that is dominated by mobile device usage.What Joe has learned about the app market is priceless and has given him a huge advantage in helping customers of Software Ops build engaging apps. Joe understands that one of the keys to creating a successful mobile app is understanding the business objectives and identifying the appropriate strategy up-front to achieve those objectives. Joe has built an experienced team at Software Ops focused on helping people and businesses mobile app platforms that are engaging and valuable to its end users.Joe is a graduate of the Aji Network’s Business Professional’s Course and currently a member of their LEIP (Leadership, Entrepreneurship, Innovation and the accumulation of Power) program. There he learn fundamental business knowledge that has helped him grow Software Ops.
name: Joe Michels
